title: 2014 Los Angeles Angels season
text:
The <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Angels">Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim</a>'s <a href="2014%20in%20baseball">2014 season</a> was the franchise's 54th season and 49th in <a href="Anaheim%2C%20California">Anaheim</a> (all of them at <a href="Angel%20Stadium">Angel Stadium</a>).
The Angels achieved a historically significant milestone during the course of the season by improving their all-time winning percentage to above the .500 mark. The Angels won their 89th game of the season on September 9 to ensure that they would become the first post-1960 expansion team to finish a season with an all-time winning record since <a href="List%20of%20Houston%20Astros%20seasons">the Houston Astros</a> at the conclusion of the 2006 MLB season.
The Angels finished the season with the best record in all of Major League Baseball, but they were swept by the <a href="2014%20Kansas%20City%20Royals%20season">Kansas City Royals</a> in the <a href="2014%20American%20League%20Division%20Series">American League Division Series</a>.
